alert.note: Alert for Lake; Orange; Seminole; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 01 at 4:07AM EDT until April 02 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Lake, Orange, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 715 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 407 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Deltona, Sanford, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Winter Park, Casselberry, Maitland, Lake Mary, Longwood, Groveland, Mascotte, Windermere, Howey-In-the-hills, Lockhart and Pine Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
